intro: Heinsenia diervilleoides subsp. mufindiensis, commonly known as the Mufindi heinsenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect stem and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
